Class Persistence

  • java.lang.Object
    • nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.persistence.Persistence
  • public class Persistence
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for the saving and loading of the game state for the game.

      • getObjectValues

        protected static nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp20.persistence.TileObject[] getObjectValues​(javax.json.JsonObject levelObject,
                                                                                     java.lang.String levelKey,
                                                                                     boolean colour)
        A helper method for getting an array of the TileObjects from a json levelobject.
        Parameters:
        levelObject - The object containing the jsonarray of object.
        levelKey - The name/key corresponding to the name of the objects.
        colour - Whether the tileobject has colour.
        Returns:
        An array of TileObjects.

      • saveGameState

        public static void saveGameState​(Maze maze,
                                 java.io.File file)
        Saves the current game state to a json file for loading later. Needs to save all the things that can change in the game.
        Parameters:
        maze - the maze to be saved.
        file - the file to be saved to.

      • loadGameState

        public static Maze loadGameState​(java.io.File gameStateFile)
        Loads a game state from the game state file which contains which number level file to be used as a base.
        Parameters:
        gameStateFile - the state file to load.
        Returns:
        the maze loaded from the game state.

      • loadGameState

        public static Maze loadGameState​(java.io.File gameStateFile,
                                 java.io.File baseMazeFile)
        Loads a game state from the game state file and the base maze file.
        Parameters:
        gameStateFile - the state file to load.
        baseMazeFile - the base maze to be altered from.
        Returns:
        the maze loaded from the game state.
